name.text: 16.1.2.5 Sequences may be neither geometric nor arithmetic

questiontext.text:
The examples of arithmetic and geometric sequences are particularly nice and relatively easy to work with. It is important to note that a general sequence will not fall into either category. One easily defined example is the harmonic sequence 

\[1,\frac12,\frac13,\frac14\,\dots,\]

whose \(n\)th term is \(\dfrac{1}{n}\), is neither arithmetic nor geometric.
